$comment: Schema file for the Set-ADDSFirewallPolicy.json config.
title: Domain Controller Firewall Configuration

^\\$.description: Allow schema declaration and other meta-properties starting with '$'.

GroupPolicyObjectName.description: The name of the Group Policy Object (GPO) that will be created or updated.

GroupPolicyObjectComment.default: This GPO is managed by the Set-ADDSFirewallPolicy.ps1 PowerShell script.
GroupPolicyObjectComment.description: The comment that will be added to the Group Policy Object (GPO).

TargetDomain.description: The domain in which the Group Policy Object (GPO) will be created or updated. This setting is only useful in multi-domain forests. If not specified, the script will attempt to determine the domain of the current user.

LogDroppedPackets.description: Indicates whether the packets dropped by the firewall should be logged.

LogAllowedPackets.description: Indicates whether the packets allowed by the firewall should be logged.

LogFilePath.description: The path to the log file that will be used to store information about the allowed and/or dropped packets.

LogMaxSizeKilobytes.description: The maximum size of the firewall log file in kilobytes.

ClientAddresses.description: List of client IP addresses from which inbound traffic should be allowed.

ManagementAddresses.description: List of IP addresses from which inbound management traffic should be allowed.

DomainControllerAddresses.description: List of domain controller IP addresses, between which replication and management traffic will be allowed.

RadiusClientAddresses.description: List of RADIUS client IP addresses from which inbound traffic should be allowed.

NtdsStaticPort.description: Static port to be used for inbound Active Directory RPC traffic.

NetlogonStaticPort.description: Static port to be used for inbound Netlogon traffic.

DfsrStaticPort.description: Static port to be used for DFSR traffic.

FrsStaticPort.description: Static port to be used for legacy FRS traffic.

WmiStaticPort.description: Indicates whether WMI traffic should use a static port.

RestrictADWS.description: Indicates whether the Active Directory Web Services (ADWS) should only be available from management IPs.

DisableNetbiosBroadcasts.description: Indicates whether the NetBIOS protocol should be switched to P-node (point-to-point).

DisableLLMNR.description: Indicates whether the Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) client should be disabled.

DisableMDNS.description: Indicates whether the Multicast DNS (mDNS) client should be disabled.

BlockManagementFromDomainControllers.description: Indicates whether management traffic from other domain controllers should be blocked.

EnableServiceManagement.description: Indicates whether remote service management should be enabled.

EnableEventLogManagement.description: Indicates whether remote event log management should be enabled.

EnableScheduledTaskManagement.description: Indicates whether remote scheduled task management should be enabled.

EnableWindowsRemoteManagement.description: Indicates whether inbound Windows Remote Management traffic should be enabled.

EnablePerformanceLogAccess.description: Indicates whether remote performance log access should be enabled.

EnableOpenSSHServer.description: Indicates whether inbound OpenSSH traffic should be enabled.

EnableRemoteDesktop.description: Indicates whether inbound Remote Desktop traffic should be enabled.

EnableDiskManagement.description: Indicates whether remote disk management should be enabled.

EnableBackupManagement.description: Indicates whether remote backup management should be enabled.

EnableFirewallManagement.description: Indicates whether remote firewall management should be enabled.

EnableComPlusManagement.description: Indicates whether inbound COM+ management traffic should be enabled.

EnableLegacyFileReplication.description: Indicates whether inbound legacy file replication traffic should be enabled.

EnableNetbiosNameService.description: Indicates whether inbound NetBIOS Name Service should be allowed.

EnableNetbiosDatagramService.description: Indicates whether inbound NetBIOS Datagram Service traffic should be allowed.

EnableNetbiosSessionService.description: Indicates whether inbound NetBIOS Session Service (NBSS) traffic should be allowed.

EnableWINS.description: Indicates whether inbound Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) traffic should be allowed.

EnableDhcpServer.description: Indicates whether inbound Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server traffic should be allowed.

EnableNPS.description: Indicates whether inbound Network Policy Server (NPS) / RADIUS traffic should be allowed.

EnableKMS.description: Indicates whether inbound Key Management Service (KMS) traffic should be allowed.

EnableWSUS.description: Indicates whether inbound Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) traffic should be allowed.

EnableWDS.description: Indicates whether inbound Windows Deployment Services (WDS) traffic should be allowed.

EnableWebServer.description: Indicates whether inbound http.sys-based web server traffic on default HTTP and HTTPS ports should be allowed.

EnableFSRMManagement.description: Indicates whether inbound File Server Resource Manager (FSRM) management traffic should be allowed.

EnablePrintSpooler.description: Indicates whether inbound Print Spooler traffic through RPC over TCP should be allowed.

EnableNetworkProtection.description: Indicates whether the Network protection feature of Microsoft Defender Antivirus should be enabled.

BlockWmiCommandExecution.description: Indicates whether to block process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands using Defender ASR.

EnableRpcFilters.description: Indicates whether additional filtering of RPC over Named Pipes should be applied.

EnableLocalIPsecRules.description: Indicates whether local IPSec rules should be enabled.

CustomRuleFileNames.description: Specifies the name(s) of additional script file(s) containing firewall rules that will be imported into the Group Policy Object (GPO).
